content: What helps with a sore throat?

There are several ways to help soothe a sore throat. Pain relievers can help alleviate the discomfort, and it's also important not to overexert your body. Drinking a glass of water can help, especially if you're experiencing acid reflux [1]. There are various types of lozenges and throat sprays available that can help relieve sore throat symptoms. You can ask at a pharmacy for advice on what might help your symptoms [2]. Over-the-counter pain medications and other remedies in the form of lozenges and oral sprays can also help [3]. Drinking plenty of fluids can help, especially warm drinks, which often soothe the throat [4]. Remember, I am not a doctor. If your symptoms worsen, please contact a healthcare professional.
